action.action-desc: Mr. Walz of Minnesota (for himself, Mr. Latham, and Mr. Runyan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

Additional sponsors: Mr. Boswell, Mr. Braley of Iowa, Ms. Bordallo, Mr. Courtney, Mr. Filner, Mr. Kind, Mr. Lamborn, Ms. McCollum, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Michaud, Mr. Bilbray, Mr. Broun of Georgia, Mr. Connolly of Virginia, Mr. Gonzalez, Mr. King of Iowa, Mr. Loebsack, Mr. Roe of Tennessee, Ms. Brown of Florida, Mr. Holden, Mr. Ross of Arkansas, Mrs. Christensen, Ms. Roybal-Allard, Mr. Faleomavaega, Mr. Rahall, Mr. Larson of Connecticut, Mr. Blumenauer, Ms. Sutton, Mrs. Davis of California, Mr. Kline, Ms. Hayworth, Mr. Bass of New Hampshire, Mr. Carney, Mr. Luetkemeyer, Mr. Palazzo, Mr. Griffin of Arkansas, Mrs. Noem, Mr. Jones, Mr. Forbes, Mr. Reyes, Mr. Frank of Massachusetts, Mr. Schiff, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Boren, Mr. Heck, Mr. Carnahan, Mr. Austin Scott of Georgia, Ms. Hirono, Mr. Crawford, Mr. Cicilline, Mr. Harper, Ms. Zoe Lofgren of California, and Ms. Herrera Beutler
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to recognize the service in the reserve components of certain persons by honoring them with status as veterans under law.

section.header: Provision of status under law by honoring certain members of the reserve components as veterans

subsection.text: Chapter 1 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 107 the following new section:

section.header: Honoring as veterans certain persons who performed service in the reserve components
section.text: Any person who is entitled under chapter 1223 of title 10 to retired pay for nonregular service or, but for age, would be entitled under such chapter to retired pay for nonregular service shall be honored as a veteran but shall not be entitled to any benefit by reason of this section.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 107 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 107A. Honoring as veterans certain persons who performed service in the reserve components.

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
